s.text: You don't even have to wait for the results.
It isn't quite as much fun as it used to be now that tobacco lobbyists are admitting that nicotine is addictive and smoking is harmful.
However, a 1991 study in the Journal of Studies on Alcohol from the Insurance Institute for Highway Safety showed otherwise.
However, a 1991 study in the Journal of Studies on Alcohol from the Insurance Institute for Highway Safety showed otherwise.
The ABI claims that there's no evidence that a 0.08 level is any more dangerous than a 0.02 level.
Second, they say it's the roaring drunks who are out there killing people.
By choosing a skinnier than average woman and defining each "drink" as 6 ounces of high-alcohol wine, they make it sound easy to hit 0.08.
